qas.question: Higher rates of health and social problems are just two of examples of effects from what?
Why does a lower level of economic growth occur due to high-end consumption?

answers.text: a lower level of economic utility in society

qas.question: What is lower in countries with more inequality for the top 21 industrialized countries?
What is a lower rate of social goods an effect of?
In U.S. states, what happens to the life expectancy in less economically equal ones?
Lower rates of health and social problems are just two of examples of effects from what?
Why does a higher level of economic growth occur due to high-end consumption?
What is higher in countries with more inequality for the top 21 industrialized countries?
What is a higher rate of social goods an effect of?
In U.S. states, what happens to the life expectancy in more economically equal ones?

context: Effects of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b5_0><b8_0>inequality<b8_0/><b5_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> researchers have found include higher rates of health and social problems, and lower rates of social goods, <a1_1>a lower level of economic utility in society<a1_1/> from resources devoted on high-end consumption, and even a lower level of economic growth when <a1_0><a1_2><b6_0>human capital is neglected<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_0/> for high-end consumption. For the top 21 industrialised countries, counting each person equally, <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a4_0><a4_1><b7_0><b9_0>life expectancy<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> is <a4_2>lower<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> in more unequal countries (r = -.907). A similar relationship exists among US states (r = -.620).
